metadata.feature_description: Displays all page templates in a hierarchical list view with thumbnails, status indicators, and action buttons

steps.expected: Templates page loads with all templates displayed
steps.actual: Page Templates heading displayed with list of templates (Cavalier - Main, Test Template Page, Test Template Valid, etc.)

steps.action: Verify templates are displayed in card/grid view
steps.expected: Templates displayed with thumbnails and names
steps.actual: 6 templates displayed as cards with thumbnails and template names visible

steps.action: Observe template cards in the list
steps.expected: Each template shows a thumbnail image
steps.actual: All templates display thumbnail images showing page previews
Large preview popup displays showing full template layout when hovering over thumbnail

steps.action: Verify status indicator element exists in DOM for templates
steps.expected: Status indicator shows for Hidden or Disabled templates
steps.actual: DOM inspection confirmed status indicator exists with 'visible' class for Cavalier - Main template (indicating Hidden or Disabled status). Test Template Page has no visible status indicator (normal template).

steps.action: Verify publish date is available in template data
steps.actual: DOM inspection confirmed all templates have 'Published:' label with date '02/09/2026' in the HTML structure. Data is rendered but may not be visually prominent in card view.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify child count displays for templates with children

steps.action: Verify child count element exists in DOM
steps.expected: Child count shows for templates with children (hidden when count is 0)
steps.actual: DOM inspection confirmed child-count element exists in all templates with display:none (all have childCount=0). Feature working correctly by hiding count when no children exist.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test empty state when no templates match search

steps.actual: Template list area shows empty white space with no templates when search returns no results

steps.action: Type 'Test' in search box and press Enter
steps.actual: Search filtered list to show 5 templates containing 'Test': Test Template Page, Test Template Valid, Thumbnail Test Template, Workflow Test Template, Test Special Characters template
All templates restored in the list after clearing search

steps.action: Click on a template to select it
steps.expected: Template is highlighted and action buttons appear
steps.actual: Template highlighted in teal color, Edit and Delete buttons appeared on the selected template card

steps.action: Verify Edit and Delete buttons exist with proper titles
steps.expected: Both Edit and Delete buttons are present and functional
steps.actual: DOM inspection confirmed: Edit button (title='Edit'), Delete button (title='Delete', not disabled) exist for all editable templates

steps.expected: Large preview popup appears showing template layout
steps.actual: Large preview popup displayed showing full page template with header, navigation, content area, and footer
Template selected (highlighted in teal), preview appears next to selected template showing full layout

steps.action: Check for templates with child pages
steps.expected: Templates with children should display child count and allow expansion
steps.actual: All current templates have childCount=0. DOM structure confirms hierarchical elements exist (child-count element, expand functionality in JS). Feature ready to display children when they exist.

observations: The template list uses a card/grid view by default showing thumbnails and names
Publish dates and status indicators exist in the DOM but may not be prominently visible in the card view styling
Large preview popups appear on hover/selection showing full template layouts
Search functionality works with real-time filtering after typing and pressing Enter
No templates with children exist in the current test environment to fully demonstrate hierarchical expansion
Status indicator for Cavalier - Main shows 'visible' class, indicating it may have Hidden or Disabled status
Special characters in template names (Test @#$%^&*()_+-=[]{}|;':".,<>?/~` Special!) are properly handled and displayed
